headline: Microchip forecasts quarterly net sales below estimates as inventory clearing weighs
summary: Microchip Technology forecast third-quarter net sales below Wall Street estimates on Thursday, ​indicating tepid demand for its chips as customers in ‌the automotive and industrial markets continue to clear excess inventory. Clients have been working to ‌lower chip inventory levels, after excessive buying during the pandemic led to a supply glut, hampering demand for providers such as Microchip. Microchip expects net sales in the range of $1.11 ⁠billion to $1.15 ‌billion for the third quarter, compared with analysts' average estimate of $1.18 billion, ‍according to data compiled by LSEG.
